citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
While the facility identified and initiated treatment for 2 dogs (identified as 024 and 038) found to have skin injuries after a
fight between the 2, these problems were not communicated to the Attending Veterinarian. Further, the written program of
veterinary care does not provide a protocol for managing or monitoring injuries prior to veterinary consultation. Failure to
notify the Attending Veterinarian regarding health problems, or failure to follow the written program of veterinary care, may
affect the health and well-being of the animals. Facilities must maintain a mechanism of direct and frequent
communication to convey accurate information regarding animal problems in a timely manner.
Correct by September 26, 2024.

The facility does not currently maintain records documenting the dates and descriptions of new problems identified,
including:
Two dogs (038 and 024) with skin injuries sustained in a fight approximately 1 week prior to inspection. The dogs were
immediately separated and the resultant scabbing and hair loss to each dog's face, and the forearm of 038, have since
been treated with topical petroleum jelly. The facility also does not maintain records of when treatment was applied.
One dog (003) found unable to move its hind legs. While a veterinarian was consulted and visited the facility to treat the
dog, the facility does not maintain a description or record of when the problem was identified or communicated to a
veterinarian.
Documentation of new problems and treatments helps assure these problems are being promptly identified and treated
appropriately. Facilities must maintain records of dates and descriptions of new problems, examination findings, test
results, treatment plans, and treatments administered or performed.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
